meanings.definition: The act or process of arranging laws or rules systematically.
meanings.sent1: The codifications of the traffic laws made it easier for everyone to understand the rules.
meanings.sent2: The legal codifications were essential for maintaining order in society.
meanings.sent3: The codifications of the school rules were so detailed that even the teachers had trouble keeping track.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous codifications of the recipe ensured that the cake turned out perfectly every time.
meanings.sent5: The codifications of the game rules were so clear that even beginners could easily follow along.

meanings.definition: A systematized collection of laws or rules.
meanings.sent1: The library contained a vast codifications of historical documents.
meanings.sent2: The codifications of the company policies were updated annually.
meanings.sent3: The codifications of the camping regulations were so strict that even the squirrels had to follow them.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a vast codifications of knowledge, organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The codifications of the traffic signs made it clear where each vehicle should go.
